intro: Echites pastorum, commonly known as the pasture bluet, is a flowering plant belonging to the Boraginaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and has a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are hairy and often have a bluish tinge, while the stems are erect and branching. Echites pastorum is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in disturbed soils.
